hook.text: Denial, anger, bargaining, depression, acceptance. You've heard the stages. But they were never meant for breakups.

discovery.text: The model was co-opted by pop psychology. It became the universal framework for every kind of grief.

twist.text: KÃ¼bler-Ross herself said the stages aren't linear. People jump, skip, and revisit them randomly.

climax.text: Grief doesn't follow a checklist. It's messy, nonlinear, and different for everyone. That's normal.

punchline.text: Grief doesn't follow stages. It follows its own chaotic path.
